question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to provide executable code for demonstration. Help me create a dinosaur-themed match-3 game as a playable webpage.

checklist.title: Is the basic match-3 gameplay mechanics fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code implements core match-3 mechanics (grid system, matching detection, piece swapping, cascading effects). Score 0 if matching logic is not implemented, 5 if only basic matching works, and 10 if advanced mechanics like cascading matches and special combinations are included.

checklist.title: Is the dinosaur theme effectively integrated into the game?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether dinosaur elements are meaningfully incorporated in visual assets, gameplay mechanics, and overall aesthetic. Deduct 5 points if dinosaurs appear only as generic icons without thematic integration, 3 points if the dinosaur theme feels disconnected from gameplay. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there a complete game progression system?
checklist.description: Check for implementation of score tracking, level progression, increasing difficulty, and win/lose conditions. Deduct 5 points if there's no scoring system, 3 points if level progression is missing, and 5 points if win/lose conditions aren't defined. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are there special game elements and power-ups?
checklist.description: Assess the implementation of special tiles, power-ups, or bonus mechanics that enhance gameplay (e.g., dinosaur-themed special matches, extinction events as power-ups, fossil collection). Deduct 5 points if no special elements exist, 3 points if they're present but not interactive. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid moves, rapid user inputs, browser resizing, etc.) and provide friendly error handling or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should handle these edge cases effectively, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Dinosaur animations for successful matches 2. Educational dinosaur facts 3. Adaptive difficulty system). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple scoring systems) 2. Function modules unrelated to the match-3 or dinosaur theme 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle effects). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating game logic/view/user input layers), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or appropriate design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no separation of concerns. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern game design principles: 1) Consistent dinosaur-themed visual elements 2) Proper layout spacing (game grid properly sized and centered) 3) Clear visual hierarchy (score display, game board, UI controls). Deduct 3 points for each cluttered visual element, 5 points for inconsistent theming, and 5 points for poor visual guidance. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the game interactions conform to expected match-3 mechanics: 1) Immediate feedback on tile selection (â‰¤100ms) 2) Smooth animations for matches and cascades (300-500ms) 3) Clear visual and audio cues for successful/unsuccessful moves. Deduct 5 points for laggy animations, 3 points for confusing interaction feedback, and 5 points for unresponsive controls. The full score is 10 points.
